CatDescriptText: Mathilda Beach, 2908 East Carson Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 5, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Should ministers take an active part in politics? Do you believe that they should hold public office?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that ministers should take a part in politics.  In fact, if they did take a more active part in politics, things would change quite a lot and for the better.  It will be a swell idea to have wise and God-sent men in politics.  And I definitely think ministers should hold public office."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mathilda Beach wearing eyeglasses, cardigan sweater with two pockets, and floral skirt, standing on sidewalk, with truck inscribed "Felix..." on right, and stores in background
